intro: Quiina maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's quiina, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers, adapted to thrive in low-nutrient, drought-prone environments. Its leaves are narrow and fibrous, often used in traditional medicine by local communities. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, Quiina maguirei is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
